document.discussion_title: WFU Adding Stadium-Wide Alcohol Sales this Fall
document.topic_text: WFU Adding Stadium-Wide Alcohol Sales this Fall By Cristen DrummondThursday, August 11, 2016 at 10:19 PM EDT WINSTON-SALEM -- Wake Forest University scores a touchdown Thursday among some sport fans. The school announced it will have beer and wine sales stadium-wide at football and basketball games beginning this Fall. “That's really exciting,” Demon Deacon fan Joshua Talley said. “Fun for everybody." The university is the first Division I school in the state to allow this type of sale at football games. Previous years, alcohol beverages were only available in select areas around BB&T Field and the Lawrence Joel Memorial Coliseum. WFU consulted other universities and learned stadium-wide sales may be better for an overall fan experience. "The behavior actually improved during the games,” athletic director, Ron Wellman said. “Fans weren't drinking too much in the parking lot knowing that they can get beer and wine in the stadium." Wake Forest is considering adding alcohol sales at other campus stadiums including baseball and soccer. The football team opens its 2016 season at BB&T Field on September 1 against Tulane.
